SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AttackCardCommand
Command to facilitate an attack between two cards on the game board.
AttackPlayerCommand
Command for executing an attack against another player using a selected card.
Board
Represents the game board in a card game, managing cards that are currently played on the board, as well as the deck and graveyard associated with a player.
Card
Represents a card in a game, encompassing all properties and behaviors including attack mechanics, health points, mana cost, and interactions with weapons.
Card_Minion
Represents a minion card in the game.
Card_Spell
Represents a spell card in the game.
Card_Weapon
Represents a weapon card in the game.
CardLibrary
Provides a static library of card definitions for players and opponents in the game.
CardView
 
Deck<T>
Represents a generic deck of elements in a game, managing operations such as adding, removing, and dealing elements.
DrawCardCommand
Command to handle the action of drawing a card from the deck and updating the hand display.
GameCommand
Represents a command within the game that can be executed.
GameLogger
Class GameLogger that implements Observer to handle and animate game logs for players and opponents.
GameManager
Manages the game state, including player turns, card interactions, task execution, and game setup.
GameOverScene
A scene representing the end of the game, displaying the game result, task verdicts, and an option to restart the game.
GameScene
The GameScene class represents the main gameplay scene of the application.
GameStartScene
The GameStartScene class is responsible for setting up and displaying the initial game start scene for the application.
GameState
Represents the state of the game, providing methods to handle actions at the start of a turn and to change turns between players.
GenericCardView
An abstract class that provides a foundation for creating card views in a user interface.
Graveyard
Represents a graveyard in a card game, where cards that are no longer in play are stored.
Hand
Represents a player's hand in a card game, holding and managing the cards that a player can use during their turn.
JudgeTask
Represents a task assigned to a judge or a game manager in the context of the game, holding relevant details like ID, description, and the owner's name.
JudgeTaskManager
Manages judge tasks and evaluates their completion during the game.
Observer
Represents an observer in the observer pattern, receiving updates based on game events.
OpponentTurnState
Represents the state of the game during the opponent's turn.
PlayCardCommand
Command to handle playing a card from the player's hand onto the game board.
Player
Represents a player in the game, managing their hand, health, mana, and other player-specific properties.
PlayerCardView
Represents a visual component for displaying player information in a card format.
PlayerTurnState
Implements the game state during a player's turn, managing turn initialization and transition to the opponent's turn.
SetupCardInteractionCommand
Command to handle the initial interaction setup for a card when selected.
TaskStatus
Maintains the status of various game metrics such as health points lost, numbers of different types of cards used, and the highest damage dealt to an opponent in one turn.
